captions.text:
SUPER MEGA WORM finds you as a SUPER MEGA
WORM, Mother Nature's last resort in destroying

humanity...oh boy howdy how you destroy. Eat
everyone, crush everything and evolve so you

can shoot killer spit and blast an EMP that
slows down time. You can also eat some moms

and then watch as their pixel babies fly through
the air...it's the most beautiful thing I've

ever filmed. But SUPER MEGA WORM don't care.
He can't hear your screams...mainly because

he lives the majority of his life underground
making it difficult for sound to propagate.

But it is even harder for sound to travel
in...

Space...team. Spaceteam is an amazing multiplayer
game. Each player is in charge of a different

control panel in a slowly falling apart spaceship.
You're given actions to perform but most of

the time it won't be for your own controls
so you have to yell it out. The game quickly

turns into a circle of people shouting at
each other and staring at their mobile device

and it is great. Spaceteam is also cross platform
so people on iOS can play with people on Android
and visa versa.

But instead of just saving you and your friends,
save the planet with...

Eve of Impact. You fire missiles at incoming
asteroids in an effort to protect the Earth

long enough to be evacuated. You can either
strategically fire the missile to explode

near the asteroid, using the blast wave to
knock it off course, or just blow it up, but

depending on the distance the debris created
can still crash into our planet. If some pieces

do hit, there is a temporary shield to let
Earth

Stay Alight. A fun game with a beautiful style
that has you tossing orbs of light at green

microbes. There are different colored sparks
that do different actions and you have to

use the environment around you to try and
get enemies in those hard to reach places.

Then let's play Puzzle and Dragons, the extremely
popular game from Japan that is a bejeweled

pokémon dungeon crawling hybrid. You fight
battles by matching the colored jewels with

the corresponding monsters you have. Every
victory adds more monsters to your collection

so you can build your team and upgrade the
characters you want. When you get repeat creatures

you can fuse them with other ones to level
up. If you want something a bit more musical
try...

Dropchord. Dropchord is like being in a music
visualizer. You place one finger on either

side of a circle, creating a beam to catch
colored dots all while music is blaring from

all around you. As the songs progress you
have to dodge red x's while still figuring

out a way to grab the glowing dots without
removing both fingers off the screen. The

game has a great soundtrack, might give you
a seizure and gets frustratingly fun as it
goes but I have something else to...

Showyou, an incredibly useful video aggregator.
It pulls in videos that have been shared from

blogs you follow, youtube channels you like
and your twitter and facebook friends. There

are a bunch of different categories to explore
and one of my favorite features is that the

app shows you if more than one of the curators
you follow shared the same video, giving you

a benchmark to know if something is truly
awesome before watching. Showyou also has

a really clean interface giving it a nice
flow...Laser Flow.

In this puzzle game you have to use mirrors
to direct the colored laser to the block of

the same color. Each round has a 1 minute
time limit and things start to get tricky

when multiple lasers are thrown in. You have
to mix them together to create the desired

color for certain blocks or use pieces to
stop a laser entirely from continuing. After

a while the levels get really difficult and
the time limit adds to the pressure. If you

mess up just remember it's not your fault,
it's

Asphalt...8. Asphalt 8 is probably one of
the most fun arcade racing games I've played

on mobile. It has awesome graphics, a massive
amount of cars to unlock and upgrade, plus

it has one thing that I don't see enough in
racing games, the ability to ram into your

opponents, destroying their vehicles. Ah,
it reminds me of San Francisco Rush. You can

unlock everything just by racing, you might
need to do a lot of racing, but luckily the

game is insanely fun so it's all good. If
you want even more speed than launch into
space with this episodes App of the Week...

Simple Rockets. If you've played Kerbal Space
Program before than Simple Rockets will feel

very familiar since it is pretty much the
same game, except on your phone and even your

WINDOWS PHONE! The game is a rocket simulator.
You construct a variety of rockets until you

find the best configuration for your outer
space exploration. Or just built stuff to

watch it explode because that is half the
fun...I tell myself to feel better! Once you

are out of our atmosphere you can orbit Smearth
or explore the Smolar System. The physics

and science in the game are fairly accurate
which adds to how fun the game is. And just

like Kerbal it takes some time to get used
to and you will probably explode numerous

times on lift off, and on landing, or as I
like to call it, graceful crashing. There

is also a great subreddit showing off the
crazy things people have made and done in
Simple Rockets.

Links to everything can be found in the description
below.
I'm Jake and as always, thanks for watching.

I got two things for you. One is a new JAM
Leanback. It's part 2 of our roadtrip and

the second one is 
bonus apps...

Bird's Journey is a game that has you trying
to flap your little wings as long you can.

It has a similar visual style to Tiny Wings
but is a really nice and relaxing game. Also
it has whales and I love whales.

Almost as much as I love quests, that take
place on my calculator. I wish someone would
make that...oh wait..

Calculator Quest. Calculator Quest is an RPG
themed calculator that has bonus games in

it to test your mathematical magic. It's a
pretty rad calculator and after you do those
sweet calculations take some

Pix, a really cool photo app. Like most photo
tools, it has a bunch of filters to choose

from but what makes Pix different is that
you can add up to 3 filters to an image and

then apply a film layer or border, giving
you something like this.

title: GIANT KILLER WORM -- App All Knight #17
